\title{
WIKIPEDIA EDUCATION PROGRAM IN THAILAND: A THREE-YEAR EXPERIENCE
}

\section*{Athikhun Suwannakhan ${ }^{1,2 *}$ and Taweetham Limpanuparb ${ }^{1}$}

1'Mahidol University International College, Nakhon Pathom 73170 Thailand
${ }^{2}$ Department of Anatomy, Faculty of Science, Mahidol University, Bangkok 10400 Thailand
*Corresponding author, email: athikhun.suw@student.mahidol.edu

\section*{BACKGROUND}
- Since the founding of Wikipedia in 2001, educators around the world have integrated the free encyclopedia which anyone can edit into their curriculum.
- Educators and students share free knowledge by contributing to Wikipedia and its sister projects in an academic setting.
- Writing Wikipedia is an opportunity to teach students $21^{\text {st }}$ century skills that most will use in their careers and personal lives such as information literacy, collaborative skill, and critial thinking.


\section*{METHODOLOGY}

- Students were introduced to Wikipedia and its education program in class.
- Student participation in the program was entirely voluntary.
- Students completed online training:
1) The cores of Wikipedia
2) Editing
3) Advanced editing

Students who did not complete the training were excluded.


Students worked on text and illustration of their article to meet course requirements. - Students' work was subject to peer review and scrutiny by other Wikipedians.


\section*{RESULTS}

\section*{Students' contributions}


Figure 1: One-hundred and three students have participated in the education program since September 2014.


Figure 2: A total of 3,204 edits were made to articles on the English Wikipedia.

\section*{CONCLUSIONS}
- Wikipedia writing assignment has been incorported into undergraduate chemistry classes at Mahidol University International College since September 2014.
- One hundred and three students participated in the program.
- Fifty six high quality articles were created, and more than 81 articles were improved.
- Students' contrubutions were equivalent to 364 written pages
- Wikipedia assignment promotes $21^{\text {st }}$ century skills such as critical thinking, collaboration, and information literacy
